Package rockpaperscissors

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • rockpaperscissors.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Ties all the methods and variables that will be used to run the game itself into one class.
    Author:
    Karanvir

    • Method Detail

      • startRound

        public void startRound​(boolean start)
        Contains all the console prompts and methods that build the basis of the game
        Parameters:
        start - Boolean that is TRUE if game is starting, or FALSE when not

      • findWinner

        public int findWinner​(int PlayerOrComp)
        Method that determines who the winner is. Capable of switching between comparing Computer vs Computer games AND Player vs Computer games If -1, Player/Computer 2 wins If 1, Computer wins If 0, Draw
        Parameters:
        PlayerOrComp - The choice the user made, for whether they want to play as the Player or watch Computer vs Computer
        Returns:
        winner The integer value that determines who won

      • findStats

        public void findStats​(int rounds)
        Prints out the statistics of the game. This includes: Wins, Losses, and Draws, and the percentage of each.
        Parameters:
        rounds - The amount of rounds that the user inputed to be played

      • StratvsPlayer

        public void StratvsPlayer​(int rounds,
                          int choice)
        Iterates through the amount of rounds inputted, prints out the computer's choice, and runs the method.
        Parameters:
        rounds - An int that gives how many rounds that the game should be played
        choice - An int showing whether the player choose to play against a Computer, or just do AI vs AI

      • RandvsPlayer

        public void RandvsPlayer​(int rounds)
        Iterates through the amount of rounds inputed, and runs the method.
        Parameters:
        rounds - An int that gives how many rounds that the game should be played

      • StratvsStrat

        public void StratvsStrat​(int rounds,
                         int choice)
        Iterates through the amount of rounds chosen, and then runs the method.
        Parameters:
        rounds - An int that gives how many rounds that the game should be played
        choice - An int showing whether the player choose to play against a Computer, or just do AI vs AI
